text: Anthea Bell OBE (10 May 1936 â€“ 18 October 2018Anthea Bell, 'magnificent' translator of Asterix and Kafka, dies aged 82) was an English translator. She was born in Suffolk and went to Somerville College, Oxford. She translated many literary works, especially children's literature, from French, German and Danish. These include Austerlitz by W. G. Sebald, the Inkworld trilogy by Cornelia Funke and the French Asterix comics along with co-translator Derek Hockridge. Bell died on 18 October 2018 from complications of Alzheimer's disease at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:British translators Category:Writers from Suffolk
